title: Drawing, "Elevation of a Mantlepiece Wall", 1770–80
medium: Pen and black ink, brush and yellow, rose and grey wash
provenance: From the Collection of Léon Decloux
creditline: Purchased for the Museum by the Advisory Council
description: A looking glass is in the over mantel. Putti form bases of candelabra on mantle shelf. Flanking mantle are two women carrying baskets on their heads, medallions above, defined by fluted pilasters. In niches on either side are putti playing in shell-shaped fountains.

tombstone.epitaph:
Drawing, "Elevation of a Mantlepiece Wall", 1770–80.
1770–80. Pen and black ink, brush and yellow, rose and grey wash. Purchased for the Museum by the Advisory Council. 1911-28-41.
